qas.question: Which Franciscan monk motivated the peasants to fight against Muslims at the Siege of Belgrade?
In what year was the Siege of Belgrade fought?
Who did the Hungarian nobility elect as King of Hungary?
Which country did Saint Francis of Capistrano come from?
When John Hunyadi died, which province was left in chaos?
Which Franciscan monk motivated the peasants to fight for Muslims at the Siege of Belgrade?
In what year wasn't the Siege of Belgrade fought?
Who didn't the Hungarian nobility elect as King of Hungary?
Which country didn't Saint Francis of Capistrano come from?
When John Hunyadi died, which province was left in peace?

context: Hunyadi succeeded during the Siege of Belgrade in <a1_0><b6_0>1456<b6_0/><a1_0/> against the Ottomans, the biggest victory against that empire in decades. This battle became a real Crusade against the Muslims, as the peasants were motivated by the Franciscan monk <a0_0><b5_0>Saint John of Capistrano<b5_0/><a0_0/>, who came from <a3_0><b8_0>Italy<b8_0/><a3_0/> predicating Holy War. The effect that it created in that time was one of the main factors that helped in achieving the victory. However the premature death of the Hungarian Lord left <a4_0><b9_0>Pannonia<b9_0/><a4_0/> defenseless and in chaos. In an extremely unusual event for the Middle Ages, Hunyadi's son, <a2_0><b7_0>Matthias<b7_0/><a2_0/>, was elected as King of Hungary by the nobility. For the first time, a member of an aristocratic family (and not from a royal family) was crowned.
